conbody.p: Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) option sets are used to specify host configurations for instances in your VPC, including the default domain name and DNS server for your instances. DHCP option sets are associated with your Eucalyptus account, and can be used across multiple VPCs.
conbody.note: Only one DHCP option set can be associated with a VPC.
conbody.p: Once you create a DHCP option set, it can't be modified. If you need to specify different DHCP options, you'll need to create a new DHCP option set. Once you've associated a new DHCP option set, new instances launched in the VPC will automatically start using the settings in the DHCP option set. Instances that are already running in the VPC will pick up the new options when their DHCP lease is renewed.
For an example, please see Working with DHCP Option Sets.
